title: An editor's retrospect;
author: Cooper, Charles Alfred
snippet: Another street adventure of mine brought home to me in a striking way the more or less unpleasant conviction that years were leaving their mark upon me. On a fine May morning I was walking home along Clerk Street in Edinburgh. The air was pleasantly warm and delightfully fresh after a hot night in the editorial room.

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: The dog-stealing business was in a depressed state, and Nick Jordan slouched along Clerk Street with his hands in his pockets, groaning over the dull times, like other business men, and wondering what the world was coming to. Nick was a man of great parts, who had been kept back in the world by ignorance, for beyond dogs he knew nothing.

title: Traced and Tracked; or, Memoirs of a City Detective, etc
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: Punctually at the hour named, Corny appeared at the place —a common stair in Clerk Street. As he was ascending the stair in search of the name furnished by his employer, that gentleman appeared descending the stair, and carrying in his arms a good-sized square parcel.

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: " But how did he do it ? How did he get possession of the key ? " I asked, incredulously. " Oh, easy ! He just followed the lad that kept the key oot to Clerk Street. It was a Saturday nicht, and the streets were thrang, but he never got a chance o' a touch till the felly stopped at a paper shop window in Clerk Street.

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: " Oh, easy ! He just followed the lad that kept the key oot to Clerk Street. It was a Saturday nicht, and the streets were thrang, but he never got a chance o' a touch till the felly stopped at a paper shop window in Clerk Street. The key was in his coat pocket, and Mike took it oot while they were baith lookin' at the pictur's in the Police News.

title: Brought to Bay; or, Experiences of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: But in this I was wrong, as I have now to show. On the night following this meeting, Eliza and Agnes, who were alone in their home in Clerk Street, were surprised by the intimation that a strange man was at the door demanding to see them. They both fluttered out in dismay, only to find their worst fears confirmed.

title: Traced and Tracked; or, Memoirs of a City Detective, etc
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: His ivory-headed umbrella and his cigar case were also identified as promptly—a clear proof that a rogue should not indulge in easily recognisable finery. Before the day of the trial we had also discovered a person living in the stair in Clerk Street who had seen the smart man loitering in the stair with the bundle and handing it over to Corny, and that, with a stolen shawl found on the back of Micky's wife, served to successfully rivet the fetters on both. The actual perpetrator of the robbery had really been the

title: The Dead Beat
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The bus stopped and started down Clerk Street and Newington as she listened, her hands tight around the Walkman, squeezing it, feeling the give in the lid, the springs on the hinge tensing and relaxing.

title: The Dead Beat
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'I met Ian in the Southern Bar on Clerk Street, did you know that?'
